description.narrative: Inabensa Bharat''s operations will support the construction of solar energy plants globally by providing a necessary component in the form of the solar panel structure, thereby encouraging the use of clean energy and reducing CO2 emissions through the implementation of clean energy plants. In addition, Inabensa Bharat will support improvements in the infrastructure supply chain through the increased manufacture and sale of transmission towers across Asia, the Middle East and Sub-Saharan Africa to meet growing demand. As a result of increased focus on transmission capability in India, energy access is expected to improve. Finally, the project will support job creation in India, both during the expansion and operation of the facility, a key objective for the Indian government.

The greenfield project is to construct a steel fabrication plant in the state of Gujarat, near the city of Vadodara with an annual capacity of 25,000 tons. The plant will manufacture in roughly equal quantity steel structures for transmission & distribution (T&D) projects and metallic support structures for the cylindrical parabolic solar collectors (CPC) and heliostats in concentrated solar power (CSP) projects that will be developed globally, including in India and neighboring countries.
